Detailed Description

Attention: This class is a wrapper over a data-stream (no data is copied). Only the anchor of the byte-stream is needed the initialize the access to the class members.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN UserData::Append (  const InformationElement &  information_element  ) 
 

Appends InformationElements to UserData (resp. UserDataHeader). It is possible to append more than one InformationElement to the UserData (only limited by the maximum size), but it is not allowed to append any InformationElement after writing the text to the UserData!

INT UserData::CalculateUserDataSize (  INT  header_size,
INT &  data_length,
const WString *  text,
INT  text_length,
DataCodingScheme::Alphabet  alphabet
)  [static]
 

Returns the size (in bytes) required to code a text (identified by text, text_length and alphabet), which is appended to a header with header_size (in bytes), and a data with data_length (in septets, octets or double-byte). The parameter the data_length is updated to the new coded length (in septets, octets or double-byte). If text_length is less than zero then the correct length of text (text->length) is used.

UINT8 * UserData::GetData (   )

TP-UD: TP-User-Data (3GPP 23.040 V5.1.0 [9.2.3.24]).

INT UserData::GetLength (   )  const
 

TP-UDL: TP-User-Data-Length (3GPP 23.040 V5.1.0 [9.2.3.16]) The length-value can be in septets (if DefaultAlphabet is used) or in octets (otherwise).

INT UserData::GetPayloadOffset (   )  const
 

Returns the offset to the start of the payload (excl. UserDataHeader) from the view of the TPDU raw data.

const UINT8* UserData::GetStartAddress (   )  const [inline]
 

returns the startaddress of the whole user-data

INT UserData::GetTextData (  UINT8 *&  text,
UINT8 &  padding
)  const
 

Returns the start address of text, including the padding bits (relevant in case of existing UserDataHeader by using DefaultAlphabet). As return parameter the length of text can be retrieved.

INT UserData::GetTextDataLength (   )  const
 

text length of the user data, which can be retrieved with GetTextData().

void UserData::SetLength (  INT  length  ) 
 

TP-UDL: TP-User-Data-Length (3GPP 23.040 V5.1.0 [9.2.3.16]).

INT UserData::Write (  const WString &  text  ) 
 

Writes the text to the user data and returns the number of converted characters. Coding is done internally according the the TPDU's data coding scheme. Writing text on UserData is allowed only once.

INT UserData::WritePayloadData (  const BlobObject &  blob  ) 
 

Writes the payload data (excl. UserDataHeader) to the user data and returns the number of written bytes. No coding is performed, if DCS is set to 8bit alphabet. If the DCS is set to another alphabet, data will be transormed and coded, according to the DCS. Writing text on UserData is allowed only once.
